pull.title: Rationalize the CValidationState interface by splitting ::DoS across ::Invalid and ::Corrupt
pull.body:
This removes the always-false return argument, and splits the DoS
responsibility across, ::Invalid, and ::Corrupt which together encode
the possiblyCorrupt argument into a method-level concern. This
makes the interface more explicit by making this literal argument
self-explanatory, and by not separating the message strings.

events.body: I believe #11639 reworks some of this as well?
Looks like they are compatible, but whichever is second would need to be rebased / adapted.

verification.payload:
tree fd09eb0dea072a94b58ff183366b1c85979b39eb
parent 32005810b2bc88b3e0132f863622684f71f24033
author Ben Woosley <ben.woosley@gmail.com> 1517844945 -0500
committer Ben Woosley <ben.woosley@gmail.com> 1517849125 -0500

Introduce CValidationState::Corrupt and privatize ::DoS

::Invalid, and ::Corrupt together encode the possiblyCorrupt argument into
a method-level concern. This makes the interface more explicit by making
this literal argument self-explanatory, and by not separating the
message strings.

events.message:
Introduce CValidationState::Corrupt and privatize ::DoS

::Invalid, and ::Corrupt together encode the possiblyCorrupt argument into
a method-level concern. This makes the interface more explicit by making
this literal argument self-explanatory, and by not separating the
message strings.

events.body:
This is a subset of changes made in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11523.

I can rebase it if there's any demand for that work (it seemed not to be the case?)
Ah thanks Jeremy, didn’t see yours. Agree there are some clear improvements to be made here. I’ll leave this open and comment on yours.
Going for a more incremental approach, in hopes of simplifying review. #12463
